intro: Aria thibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Aria thibetica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
